messageBody:
David,

I cannot update the version of Junit. I work as a part of a large product,
where a small change could mean big things.

I would really appreciate, if I could get the solution without upgrading.

Thanks
Deepankar


On Thu, May 21, 2009 at 7:07 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

>
>
> Deepankar,
>
> In recent versions of JUnit, you could add the @BeforeClass and
> @AfterClass to EmployeeTestAMAllTests. I'm doubting that feature goes
> as far back as 4.1, but haven't checked. Can you upgrade?
>
> David Saff
>
>
> On Thu, May 21, 2009 at 8:47 AM, Deepankar <deepankar.narang@...<deepankar.narang%40gmail.com>>
> wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I am currently using Junit 4.1. I have a requirement in which i need to
> get
> > the session before any junit class starts execution. I can not do this at
> > @BeforeClass level.
> >
> > I need to do this at TestSuite Level.
> >
> > My test suite looks like
> >
> > import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> > import org.junit.runners.Suite;
> >
> > @RunWith(Suite.class)
> > @...( {EmployeeTest.class,DepartmentTest.class})
> > public class EmployeeTestAMAllTests {
> > }
> >
> > I need to instantiate session before EmployeeTest and destroy it post
> > DepartmentTest. I can certainly write this in @BeforeClass of
> EmployeeTest &
> > @AfterClass of DepartmentTest, but this would not resolve the issue.
> >
> > I want a generalized solution, in which even if I dont know the starting
> and
> > end Junit classes, the instantiation and destruction process should run
> > independently.
> >
> >
> > Thanks In Advance
> >
> >
> > Regards
> > Deepankar
